From the elder, to Gaius my dear brother, whom I love in truth.
undefined Dear friend, I pray that all may go well with you and that you may be in good health, just as it is well with your soul.
undefined For I rejoiced greatly when the brothers came and testified to your truth, just as you are living according to the truth.
undefined I have no greater joy than this: to hear that my children are living according to the truth.The Charge to Gaius
undefined Dear friend, you demonstrate faithful-ness by whatever you do for the brothers (even though they are strangers).
undefined They have testi-fied to your love before the church. You will do well to send them on their way in a manner worthy of God.
undefined For they have gone forth on behalf of “The Name,” accepting nothing from the pagans.
undefined Therefore we ought to support such people, so that we become coworkers in cooperation with the truth.Diotrephes the Troublemaker
undefined I wrote something to the church, but Diotrephes, who loves to be first among them, does not acknowledge us.

undefined Therefore, if I come, I will call attention to the deeds he is doing – the bringing of unjustified charges against us with evil words! And not being content with that, he not only refuses to wel-come the brothers himself, but hinders the people who want to do so and throws them out of the church!
undefined Dear friend, do not imitate what is bad but what is good. The one who does good is of God; the one who does what is bad has not seen God.Worthy Demetrius
undefined Demetrius has been testified to by all, even by the truth itself. We also testify to him, and you know that our testimony is true.
undefined I have many things to write to you, but I do not wish to write to you with pen and ink.
undefined But I hope to see you right away, and we will speak face to face.
undefined Peace be with you. The friends here greet you. Greet the friends there by name.
